docs.abstract: Charles Granby of Campus Magnet High School in Queens coaches his last boys' basketball game, ending a 45-year career; has most victories in the history of New York’s Public Schools Athletic League, and remembers the glory days that stretched across six decades.

docs.abstract: Ramogi Huma is the president of the newly formed College Athletes Players Assn, union that is seeking to represent football and basketball players; he turns in a petition seeking recognition for Northwestern football players to a regional office of the National Labor Relations Board Chicago, marking the first attempt by college athletes to organize.

headline.main: As Northwestern Players Pursue Unionization, a Voice in the Wilderness Gains a Chorus

docs.snippet: North Korea has rescinded an invitation for a senior U.S. official to visit Pyongyang to seek the release of imprisoned U.S. missionary Kenneth Bae, a State Department official said on Sunday, adding civil rights activist Jesse Jackson had offered...
docs.lead_paragraph: North Korea has rescinded an invitation for a senior U.S. official to visit Pyongyang to seek the release of imprisoned U.S. missionary Kenneth Bae, a State Department official said on Sunday, adding civil rights activist Jesse Jackson had offered to go to Pyongyang to try to free Bae.

headline.main: North Korea Rescinds Invite to Seek Bae Release, Jesse Jackson Offers to Go: U.S. Official
